messageBody:
I ran into this problem too when I first started using JUnit. The solution is to use the same package but a different
directory. As long as your classpath includes both directories when you are testing all the necessary classes will be
found and everything should work fine.

/src/java/com/nameless/foo.java
/src/javatest/com/nameless/fooTest.java

/classes/java/com/nameless/foo.class
/classes/javatest/com/nameless/fooTest.class

I seem to recall this being suggested somewhere in the JUnit documentation.

I do this from within JBuilder with two projects working in parallel. The application is configured as a library to the
testing project. JBuilder seems to want to recompile the application classes into the testing class directory structure
but this causes no real problems.

Scott
